channel.title: Films/series involving beasts from different dimensions...?
channel.description:
Can you remember any films or TV series involving creatures from other dimensions, a la Half Life? I can recall two, the first one properly Lovecraftian:
[url]https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/From_Beyond_%28film%29[/url]
... in which a resonator is used to access other dimensions. Second, a BBC series, involving creatures that were slipping through into our dimension in order to harvest people's serotonin. I was only young, so the rubbish special effects didn't change the fact it was proper scary. That was -
[url]https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Invasion:_Earth_%28TV_series%29[/url]
p.s. some more: [url]https://answers.yahoo.com/question/index?qid=20091019220457AAyEspj[/url]
Any more?

item.title: Films/series involving beasts from different dimensions...?
item.dc:creator: bigfan421
item.description:
There’s this one BBC series we get on the SyFy channel here in the states called Primeval, A whole bunch of dinosaurs and Prehistoric beasts are portalled into modern day Great Britain.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Primeval
There’s also a few episodes where Beasts that aren’t from Earth appear.
EDIT
Oh and OP, thanks for stealing my Avatar.

Read full topic

item.title: Films/series involving beasts from different dimensions...?
item.dc:creator: Mith
item.description:
the mist is an awesome book and the movie adaption is surprisingly good as well

the awesome his dark materials trilogy from phillip pullman also has a story revolving around parallel universes/dimensions. sadly the movie for the golden compass sucks balls imo, and i don’t think they’re adapting the other 2 books

Read full topic

item.title: Films/series involving beasts from different dimensions...?
item.dc:creator: DanO
item.description:
Jeannotvb:

The Mist (trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LhCKXJNGzN8)

And I see -

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Mist

  • that valve actually “listed The Mist among their primary influences for the game plot [of half-life]. The first game in the series was originally going to be called Quiver, as a reference to the Arrowhead base from The Mist.”
